title: Magic Lantern Workshop Adventure #17
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Magic Lantern Workshop Floor
rooms.description: A cluttered Victorian workshop filled with brass fittings, glass lenses, and wooden lantern frames. Workbenches line the walls, covered with tools and half-assembled magic lanterns. The smell of oil and wood polish fills the air. Painted glass slides hang on display racks, casting colorful shadows in the gaslight. A locked cabinet stands against the far wall, and a heavy door leads north to the projection theater.

items.name: master workbench
items.description: A large wooden workbench covered with brass tools, lenses, and lantern components

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A delicate brass key with an ornate handle shaped like a lantern

items.name: locked tool cabinet
items.description: A tall wooden cabinet with glass doors, secured with a brass lock

items.name: workshop ledger book
items.description: A leather-bound ledger with records of lantern orders and repairs
items.text: Workshop Ledger - Proprietor: Master Cornelius Blackwood. Established 1842. Specializes in hand-painted slides and precision optical instruments. Note: The finest optical glass comes from the Bavarian Mountains, imported at great expense.

items.name: storage chest with drawers
items.description: A wooden chest with three drawers for storing lantern slides and components

items.name: apprentice's note
items.description: A handwritten note on yellowed paper
items.text: Reminder to self: Master Blackwood keeps the theater key in the middle drawer. The combination is the year he founded this workshop - check the painted slide commemorating our opening day!

items.name: iron theater key
items.description: A heavy iron key labeled 'Projection Theater'

items.name: display rack of painted slides
items.description: A wooden rack holding colorful hand-painted glass slides for magic lanterns
items.text: The slides show various scenes: landscapes, fairy tales, and historical events. One slide is labeled 'Grand Opening - Blackwood's Magic Lantern Workshop - 1842' and shows a painting of the workshop's facade.

items.name: partially assembled lantern
items.description: A beautiful brass lantern in mid-construction, missing its lens assembly

items.name: theater entrance door
items.description: A heavy wooden door with frosted glass panels etched with images of magic lanterns. A keyhole sits beneath the brass handle.

rooms.name: Projection Theater
rooms.description: A small intimate theater with rows of velvet seats facing a white projection screen. A magnificent brass magic lantern sits on a table in the center, its polished surfaces gleaming. The walls are decorated with framed certificates and awards. A portrait of Master Blackwood hangs prominently. The master's private studio door is visible to the east, secured with an elaborate lock mechanism.

items.name: demonstration magic lantern
items.description: An exquisite brass lantern with intricate engravings and a set of painted slides loaded in the carousel
items.text: The lantern is set up with a series of slides telling a story. The title slide reads: 'The Master Craftsman's Journey - A Tale of Light and Shadow by Cornelius Blackwood'

items.name: portrait of Master Blackwood
items.description: An oil painting of a distinguished gentleman with a white beard, holding a magic lantern
items.text: Portrait of Cornelius Blackwood, Master Lantern Maker. The brass plaque reads: 'Founder and proprietor, creator of the finest optical instruments in all of England.'

items.name: framed certificates
items.description: Several certificates and awards mounted on the wall
items.text: Awards from the Royal Society of Arts, the Crystal Palace Exhibition, and various trade guilds. One certificate notes: 'For excellence in optical craftsmanship using the finest Bavarian glass.'

items.name: theater seating
items.description: Rows of comfortable velvet-upholstered seats for viewing lantern shows

items.name: Master Blackwood's private journal
items.description: A small leather journal tucked between the seat cushions
items.text: Private Journal: My life's work culminates in the masterpiece lantern I'm completing in my studio. To protect it, I've secured the studio door with questions only I can answer. Who am I? Where does my finest glass originate? What is my life's passion?

items.name: projection table
items.description: A sturdy table holding the demonstration lantern and various accessories

items.name: master's studio door
items.description: An ornate door with brass fittings and a complex lock mechanism. A brass panel displays three questions engraved in elegant script.

password_questions.question: Who is the master of this workshop?
password_questions.hint: Check the workshop ledger and the portrait in the theater

password_questions.question: Where does the finest optical glass come from?
password_questions.hint: The workshop ledger and award certificates mention the source of the glass

password_questions.question: What is the master craftsman's passion?
password_questions.hint: Look at what the workshop creates and what Master Blackwood holds in his portrait

rooms.name: Master Blackwood's Private Studio
rooms.description: You have entered the master craftsman's private sanctuary! The studio is bathed in soft light filtering through stained glass windows. In the center, on a velvet-covered pedestal, sits the most magnificent magic lantern you have ever seen - a masterpiece of brass, crystal, and hand-painted glass. Its lenses catch the light and project dancing rainbows across the walls. This is the culmination of a lifetime of craftsmanship. A door to the outside world stands open, beckoning you to freedom.

items.name: Master Blackwood's Masterpiece Lantern
items.description: An absolutely stunning magic lantern crafted from polished brass, crystal lenses, and featuring hand-painted slides of breathtaking beauty. It represents the pinnacle of the lantern maker's art.

items.name: display pedestal
items.description: A pedestal covered in rich burgundy velvet, designed to showcase the masterpiece lantern

items.name: stained glass windows
items.description: Beautiful windows depicting scenes of light, art, and craftsmanship
items.text: The windows show various scenes: a craftsman at work, light breaking through darkness, and the magic of projected images bringing stories to life.

items.name: master's private workbench
items.description: An immaculately organized workbench with the finest tools and materials

items.name: Master Blackwood's final note
items.description: A letter addressed 'To whoever finds this'
items.text: My dear finder, if you have reached this studio, you have proven yourself worthy of understanding the magic of light and shadow. This lantern is my legacy - may it inspire you as the craft has inspired me. Go forth and share the wonder of projected light with the world. - Cornelius Blackwood

rooms.win_message: You have discovered Master Blackwood's legendary masterpiece lantern! As you carefully lift the magnificent device, its crystal lenses catch the light and project a final message on the wall: 'The magic of light lives on.' You have successfully navigated the workshop, solved its mysteries, and earned the right to carry on the master craftsman's legacy. You win!
